# Connect to SCCM Instance/Site
# Press 'F5' to run this script. Running this script will load the ConfigurationManager
# module for Windows PowerShell and will connect to the site.
#
# This script was auto-generated at '4/25/2022 5:30:34 PM'.

# Site configuration
$SiteCode = "ACX" # Site code 
$ProviderMachineName = "cwywsm01" # SMS Provider machine name

# Customizations
$initParams = @{}
#$initParams.Add("Verbose", $true) # Uncomment this line to enable verbose logging
#$initParams.Add("ErrorAction", "Stop") # Uncomment this line to stop the script on any errors

# Do not change anything below this line

# Import the ConfigurationManager.psd1 module 
if((Get-Module ConfigurationManager) -eq $null) {
    Import-Module "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Configuration Manager\AdminConsole\bin\ConfigurationManager.psd1" @initParams 
}

# Connect to the site's drive if it is not already present
if((Get-PSDrive -Name $SiteCode -PSProvider CMSite -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue) -eq $null) {
    New-PSDrive -Name $SiteCode -PSProvider CMSite -Root $ProviderMachineName @initParams
}

# Set the current location to be the site code.
Set-Location "$($SiteCode):\" @initParams

##################################

#Navigate to the folder Application\_Cleanup\
PS ACX:\> dir 			[Enter] #to see file structure
PS ACX:\> cd Application 	[Enter]
PS ACX:\> cd _Cleanup 		[Enter]
PS ACX:\> dir 			[Enter]

PSPath                : AdminUI.PS\CMSite::cwywsm01\Application\_Cleanup
PSParentPath          : AdminUI.PS\CMSite::cwywsm01\Application
PSChildName           : _Cleanup
PSDrive               : ACX
PSProvider            : AdminUI.PS\CMSite
PSIsContainer         : True
SmsProviderObjectPath : SMS_ObjectContainerNode.ContainerNodeID=16777372
ContainerNodeID       : 16777372
FolderFlags           : 0
FolderGuid            : 228B1336-73F6-4356-B17D-6EDF2ACFD893
IsEmpty               : False
Name                  : PatchMyPCTest
ObjectType            : 6000
ObjectTypeName        : SMS_ApplicationLatest
ParentContainerNodeID : 16777531
SearchFolder          : False
SearchString          : 
SourceSite            : ACX

Then find the PatchMyPCTest folder and notate the ObjectType, Name, ContainerNodeID

ObjectType 6000 is for software folders

#Get a list of all ObjectType 6000 folders and their names:
Get-WmiObject -ComputerName $ProviderMachineName -Namespace "root\sms\site_$($SiteCode)" -Query "select * from SMS_ObjectContainerNode where ObjectType='6000'" | select name

#Remove a software folder:
Get-WmiObject -ComputerName $ProviderMachineName -Namespace "root\sms\site_$($SiteCode)" -Class SMS_ObjectContainerItem | Where-Object {$_.ContainerNodeID -eq "16777372"} | Remove-WMIObject -WhatIf
